thread.title: Fordham beats Holy Cross 47-41 in OT
thread.title_full: Fordham beats Holy Cross 47-41 in OT

title: Fordham beats Holy Cross 47-41 in OT
text:
Edmonds with 4 TDs leads Fordham to 47-41 win over Holy Cross in OT THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   5:14   5:14   
Subjects: 
New York (1742) 

BRONX, New York — Chase Edmonds rushed for four touchdowns, including the game-winner in overtime, to lead Fordham to a 47-41 win over Holy Cross on Saturday. 
Edmonds rushed for 162 yards for the Rams (7-1, 1-0 Patriot League). Kevin Anderson threw for 194 yards and two scores. 
In overtime, Edmonds took it in from 7 yards following a missed Holy Cross field goal to give Fordham the win. 
Edmonds ran for two scores in the first half and Anderson added a pair of touchdown passes to Ben Johnson to give Fordham a 27-17 lead at halftime. 
A.J. Wells scored on a 52-yard kickoff return early in the second half and Edmonds scored his third touchdown late in the third quarter to erase a brief Holy Cross lead. Then Zane Wasp hit a 48-yard field goal for the Crusaders (2-4, 0-1) sending the game into overtime. 
Peter Pujals finished with 508 yards and four touchdowns for the Crusaders.
